newsitem.title: USA: Lab Corp. of America pays $700,000 to settle.
newsitem.headline: Lab Corp. of America pays $700,000 to settle.

text.p: Laboratory Corp. of America Holdings has paid the United States $700,000 to settle allegations that it overcharged Medicare for reimbursements for expenses, the Department of Justice said Tuesday.
The case involved expenses for car mileage by technicians who drove their own cars to draw blood samples from patients at home or in nursing homes from 1989 to 1996, it said.

The agreement settled allegations that LabCorp defrauded Medicare through Florida facilities formerly owned by its National Health Laboratories subsidiary, according to Assistant Attorney General Frank Hunger of the Justice Department's Civil Division and U.S. Attorney William Keefer of Miami.
LabCorp is a clinical laboratory operator based in Burlington, N.C..
Its stock rose 12.5 cents to $2.75 on the New York Stock Exchange in early afternoon trading.
